name: üì∑Studio jangmyeon
description: Old-fashioned black-and-white portrait studio in Busan. Quiet, nostalgic, a bit rough around the edges. {D:A1,W:F4W,w:W30,P:FB,p:RR,mesh:3}

events.description: Starts the day with a cup of instant ramen at his desk, steam fogging up the old window. Kitties 'Yeong-sook' and 'Byung-chul' circle his feet for scraps.
Pulls up the rattling metal shutter and flips the wooden 'Ïó¥Î¶º' sign. Sweeps the front step while sipping leftover coffee.
Mrs. Park from the hanbok store next door stops by with side dishes. He bows politely and gives her a new photo print of her late husband.
Leaves tuna cans by the back door and calls softly for 'Yeong-sook' and 'Byung-chul.' Sometimes they bring a friend.
Camera slung over his shoulder, he walks through the silent warehouses and rusted fences. Captures shadowy alleys and forgotten signs.

events.summary: Close Studio Early for Commercial Gig
events.description: Tapes a handwritten note on the door: 'Ï¥¨ÏòÅ Ïô∏Î∂Ä ÏùºÏ†ïÏúºÎ°ú Îã´ÏäµÎãàÎã§.' Changes into clean clothes and grabs his gear bag.

Two guys in track suits knock and push their way in, reeking of soju. They brought a plastic bag with dried squid and convenience store snacks, already half-drunk. They slap his back too hard, call him 'artist-nim,' and sit on his work table without asking. He makes them instant coffee but doesn‚Äôt sit down.
Turns off the lights, leaves one lamp glowing above a black-and-white portrait of a little girl. Folds into his futon beside a shelf of old negatives.
